ziINK2ON.question: Two aircraft are experiencing communication failure. Aircraft A is on a VFR flight on the downwind leg to land at a controlled aerodrome. Aircraft B is also on a VFR flight cruising atFL55. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A watch shall be kept by the pilot of aircraft A as instructions may be issued by visual signals.
The arrival report can be omitted by the pilot of aircraft A, as there is an ATC unit at the aerodrome, but one must still be filed at the aerodrome reporting office at the aerodrome of departure.
For both aircraft, the general communication failure procedures of the ICAO “Rules of the Air” override any published local procedures.
If aircraft B is a VFR flight above the clouds, it may descend through the clouds to land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.

ilsN1Ejx.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC should

options.text: proceed in accordance with the current flight plan to the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome.
divert to the most suitable aerodrome according to the route of flight.
proceed to an area from where the flight can be continued according to the visual flight rules.
execute a VMC approach at the nearest suitable aerodrome.

gzPjKkR4.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in VMC should

options.text: land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
land at the alternate aerodrome.
land at the destination aerodrome.
return to the aerodrome of departure.

A2fSl70s.question:
Refer to the following extract of an exchange of radio-communication between pilot (F-GTPO) and Lille Tower:
  • ATC: "F-PO, squawk **6151**." - Pilot: "6151, F-PO." - ATC: "F-PO, radar identified, cleared to Lille via route SA then leave controlled airspace via route N." - Pilot: "Cleared to Lille via route SA then leave controlled airspace via route N, F-PO."
After a short while, F-PO is entering controlled airspace.
  • ATC: "F-PO, Lille Tower, radio check 118.550."
No answer.
  • ATC: "F-PO, Lille Tower, if you read me, squawk IDENT."
No answer but the controller's radar shows that IDENT has been operated. Which of the following statements are correct if specific procedures for communication failure procedures have not been established for Lille Tower? - F-PO shall exit controlled airspace as soon as possible because of the communication failure. - F-PO is a controlled flight and must continue its transit to follow its clearance, unless this is incompatible with the regulation application for communication failure. - F-PO will not receive any instruction from Lille Tower that will alter its transit clearance, other traffic will be instructed away from F-PO to maintain separation as applicable. - F-PO may receive additional instructions from Lille Tower and the clearances can be acknowledged by operating the transponder.

LHPiRISq.question: You are approaching to land and are experiencing communications receiver failure. You decide to continue the flight as planned, with an approach on RWY27. Next in your flight plan is a descent from 6 000 ft to 2 000 ft. You head to transmit blind your report to ATC, followed by a complete repetition. The phraseology you will use is:

options.text: NEXT REPORT FINAL RWY 27, CONTINUING FLIGHT AS PLANNED.
HEADING 270, CONTINUING FLIGHT AS PER FLIGHT PLAN.
NEXT REPORT FINAL RWY 27, ALL STATIONS RECEIVING RADIO CHECK.
NEXT REPORT AT TIME 1201, ALL STATIONS RECEIVING RADIO CHECK.

fx70Lh2l.question:
A pilot is flying VFR in controlled airspace when he/she notices a receiver failure
 Which of the following actions must the pilot take? 
1 Squawk 7500 and IDENT
2 Transmit reports at the scheduled times or positions
3 Precede the transmitted reports with the phrase 'TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE'
4 Transmit the reports on the frequency in use
5 Duplicate the reports on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz 
6 Exit the controlled airspace as soon as practicable.

options.text: 1 and 6

iwX1qsgX.question: After suffering a radio receiver failure the pilots should make blind transmissions preceded by the phrase “TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE” and subsequently:

options.text: advise the time of the next intended transmission.
proceed to the pre-planned alternate.
enter the next enroute holding pattern encountered.
hold for 5 minutes.

ttxVoHNA.question:
A pilot is flying VFR in controlled airspace when he/she notices a receiver failure. Which of the following actions must the pilot take?

1. Squawk 7500 and IDENT.2. Transmit reports at the scheduled times or positions.3. Precede the transmitted reports with the phrase "TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE".4. Transmit the reports on the frequency in use.5. Duplicate the reports on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz.6. Exit the controlled airspace as soon as practicable.

options.text: 1 and 6

yyW71b36.question: On an IFR flight in IMC conditions, you suspect a comms equipment failure. What actions should you take?(1) Make two blind transmissions on the frequency in use stating your intentions.(2) Divert from your current track by 45 degrees for x minutes, and return to track according to flight plan.(3) Land at the nearest suitable airfield.(4) Continue to destination as per flight plan and commence an approach as close as possible to last EAT.

options.text: 1 and 4.
1 and 3
2 and 3
2 and 4

2CgLH19P.question: An aircraft is on an IFR flight in IMC and flies through an airspace where procedural separation is applied, when it suffers a loss of radio communication. What should the pilot in command do when passing over a compulsory reporting point?

options.text: Maintain the last assigned speed and flight level or the minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 20 minutes. Thereafter, he/she shall adjust the speed and flight level according to the last approved flight plan.

Maintain his last assigned speed and flight level or the minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of 7 minutes. Thereafter, he/she shall adjust the speed and flight level according to the last approved flight plan.

Maintain the last assigned flight level or the minimum flight altitude if higher, turn right by 30° and continue parallel to the planned route with a 5 NM offset until reaching the planned destination aerodrome.
Maintain the last assigned speed and initiate a climb of 300 ft/min until reaching VMC. Then, he/she shall divert to the nearest suitable aerodrome.

tHzw8ARU.question: You are on an IFR flight and just reach the TOC (top of climb). What are you going to do if you encounter a total loss of communication in VMC?

options.text: Continue the flight in VMC and fly to the next suitable aerodrome. Report your arrival to the appropriate ATS unit as soon as possible.
Continue the flight according to the planned route. Enter the holding at the initial approach fix and hold until the estimated approach time. Thereafter you can start the approach to land.
Continue the flight in VMC and fly to the destination. Report your arrival to the appropriate ATS as soon as possible.
Continue the flight in VMC or in IMC and fly to the next airfield which provides radar services.

UQIQaxsg.question: During flight, the flight crew hears a click on the ATC frequency but no voice. Nevertheless the frequency is blocked. What is most likely the reason?

options.text: The carrier wave is received but is not modulated.
The aircraft communications equipment has failed.
An interference with another station calling has occurred.
The modulating wave is received but the carrier wave is missing.

sZ8ebUXr.question: An aircraft under radar, flying IFR in IMC, is cleared to a new altitude. Just after reaching the cleared altitude, 8 NM before the next compulsory reporting point, it is unable to establish two way communication again. The pilot immediately sets the transponder code **7600**. Considering the order of events, the pilot should remain at the cleared altitude...

options.text: for 7 minutes after the compulsory reporting point.
for 12 minutes after reaching the compulsory reporting point.
for 7 minutes after setting transponder code 7600.
for 20 minutes after first noting the communications failure.

S7OfUm8L.question: You are flying in IMC under radar control, and you experience a communication failure. You squawk **7600** and maintain the last assigned speed and level for...

options.text: 7 minutes.
5 minutes.
20 minutes.
15 minutes.

cfRQIjyA.question: An aircraft during an IFR flight in IMC encounters a radio failure. The pilots must descent to perform an instrument approach...

options.text: at the designated navigation aid or navigation fix.
at the calculated TOD point.
at the current EAT.
any time when flying in the ATZ.

EvW6s5Ce.question: When an aircraft flying IFR in IMC encounters a radio communication failure, and it is being vectored or has been directed by ATC to proceed offset using RNAV without a specified limit, it shall proceed in the most direct manner possible to rejoin the current flight plan route, taking into consideration the applicable minimum flight altitude...

options.text: no later than the next significant point.
at the final approach fix.
at the designated navigational aid.
at the initial approach fix.

ey7ggsRr.question: You are flying IFR in IMC. While you are on radar vectors, you suffer a communication failure. After resetting your transponder to **7600**, what will be the correct action?

options.text: Rejoin your current flight plan not later than next significant point.
Hold your heading for 7 minutes.
Turn towards the next suitable aerodrome for landing.
Hold your altitude for 7 minutes.

IyJkISs0.question:
You have received the following take-off clearance: "YR-BTO, CLIMB STRAIGHT AHEAD UNTIL 4000 FT, BEFORE TURNING RIGHT HEADING 270, REPORT RIGHT TURN. RUNWAY 09 CLEARED FOR TAKE-OFF." 
After take-off you are experiencing communications receiver failure and need to transmit blind your report to ATC, followed by a complete repetition. What phraseology will you use? "YR-BTO, TRANSMITTING BLIND DUE TO RECEIVER FAILURE...

options.text: ...RIGHT TURN HEADING 270 MAINTAINING 4000 FT. CONTINUING VFR FOR LANDING RWY 09."
...RIGHT TURN MAINTAINING 4000 FT. NEXT REPORT AT TIME 1201. ALL STATIONS RADIO CHECK."
...RIGHT TURN. CONTINUING VFR FOR LANDING RWY 09. NEXT REPORT FINAL."
...RIGHT TURN HEADING 270 SPEED 160 KNOTS. CONTINUING VFR FOR LANDING RWY 09."

eZrHCx8p.question: After reaching a reporting point while under radar control, you contact ATC to request a new flight level but cannot establish communications. What should you do?

options.text: Stay on the previous flight level for 7 minutes, then proceed with the filed flight plan.
Land at the nearest aerodrome.
Stay at previous flight level for 20 minutes, then proceed with flight plan.
Proceed directly to new flight level, continue trying to contact ATC or start blind transmissions.

KrN8BR1H.question: You are flying under IFR, en route, and are experiencing communication failure. How would you proceed in this circumstance?

options.text: Weather permitting, proceed in VMC to the nearest suitable aerodrome, reporting your arrival by the most expeditious means to ATC.
Set the transponder code to 7700, change to VFR and complete the remainder of the flight in VMC,

icl0qQE8.question: You are the pilot of a single-engined piston engine aircraft on an IFR flight that experiences an engine failure. MAYDAY, MAYDAY, MAYDAY, OAL 136, turning left heading 100 climbing to 7 000 ft.
PAN PAN (x3), Bern Departure, OAL 136, unable RNAV due equipment, turning left heading 100 climbing to 7 000 ft.

MEDICAL, FASTAIR 789, A PASSENGER IS FEELING UNWELL, RETURNING TO WALDEN, 20 MILES WEST OF WALDEN, FL150, HEADING 280.

Suddenly a fire develops on board and immediately the pilot decides to descend to FL 70 and divert to the nearest suitable airport Brussels-Charleroi (EBCI), located to the right of track. The recommended order to communicate this emergency situation to ATC, if possible, is...

options.text: Mayday, Mayday, Mayday, Brussels Control, Flugprop 565, fire on board, diverting to Charleroi, position RODRI, descending FL 70, heading 180°

Mayday, Mayday, Mayday, Brussels Control, turning right to Charleroi due to fire on board, descending FL 70, passing RODRI, diverting, Flugprop 565
